content:
I understand your point of view. Although digital artwork advancements have come far in imitating traditional mediums, there are still certain qualities that make traditional art mediums special, such as the tactile quality and unique character that each piece of artwork produces. The slight variations and the subtle textures of traditional mediums can add a human touch that digital art might lack.

That being said, many artists in recent years have combined the use of traditional and digital mediums to create mixed media artwork that showcases the benefits of both approaches. They can create digital art and then print it on a traditional canvas or paper, emphasizing the textures and variations that traditional mediums offer – while still being able to achieve the precision and flexibility of digital methods in the creation process.

Ultimately, as technology and society evolve, it's fascinating to see how traditional and digital art forms evolve, coexist, and influence each other in exciting ways. Both forms have their unique qualities, and the decision to choose which one to use comes down to each artist's personal preference and style.
